application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Application to clear condition 10 (energy demand and carbon emissions reporting), 12 (overheating risks) and 13 (water efficiency calculator) of approved application DM2023/01511.
decision_conditions: Prior to commencement, a detailed strategy for managing heat risk together with a TM59 assessment must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing in order to identify overheating risks and proposed cooling measures. The submitted information must demonstrate compliance with the Mayor's cooling hierarchy and meet the overheating risk criteria for the probabilistic Design Summer Year (DSY1, DSY2 and DSY3) weather datasets, taking account of Approved Document O requirements). All of the approved cooling measures must thereafter be retained for as long as the development is in existence.Reason: To comply with Policy 31 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

Prior to first occupation of the development, a completed Water Efficiency Calculator for New Dwellings must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that internal potable water consumption for each of the dwellings will be limited to 110 litres per person per day (l/p/d) based on the Government's national calculation method for the purposes of Part G of the Building Regulations.Reason: To comply with Policy 33 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

Prior to commencement of the development, a plan for monitoring and annual reporting of post-construction energy demand and carbon emissions for five years must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing inaccordance with Mayoral guidance on 'Be Seen' (GLA, 2022).Reason: To comply with Policy 31 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018
